results.title: European Art School: 1
results.creator_credit: Anders Holmertz and European Art School
results.brief_description: Presented by Mario Massanyi and his colleagues this program presents an easy to follow guide to basic drawing and the range of preferred tools that can be used in the process. It covers techniques such as contour drawing, gesture drawing and modelling and highlights practical examples for practicing drawing skills. The episode ends with a tour of a pencil factory where some of the materials discussed earlier in the program are looked at in detail.

results.title: Europe by train
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and James Ritchie
results.brief_description: Douglas Brown, journalist and traveller, takes us about Europe telling of his experiences of many different countries: Italy, Switzerland, Germany and Spain. Lingering in stations, or riding on some crack continental expresses, he conveys the excitment of travelling abroad and shows how he makes the journey an interesting part of a holiday or a business trip.

results.title: Europa nostra
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford, World Wide Pictures and Charles Mapleston
results.brief_description: Shot in fifteen countries in Western and Eastern Europe, this film touches upon all aspects of conservation, including: treasures lost, restoration, new uses for old buildings, traffic, pressures of tourism, unsightly advertising, and the activities of local authorities and conservation authorities.

results.title: Europa
results.brief_description: Animated film giving thumb-nail description of the history of Europe. It then switches to a summary of the federation movement in the United States and its advantages. Concludes by pointing to potential future advantages of a European Community movement.

results.title: Eureka
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Peach’s gold”.
Through dramatised re-enactments, as well as historical footage, Bill Peach traces the events which led to the dramatic confrontation at the Eureka stockade, one of the key incidents in Australian political history. He investigates the issues behind the uprising between the miners, the police and the army caused by harsh and expensive licensing systems and describes how long-term effects eventually led to the introduction of safer and fairer working conditions.

results.title: Eureka
results.brief_description: Highly commended entry into the “Make a stamp come alive” category of Screen It! This film recounts the story of famous revolt in Ballarat and the subsequent discovery of gold. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Euphronius painted: Krater of Heracles and Antaeus ...
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Pascal Vimenet, Delta Image, La Sept, FR3 and Musée du Louvre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
The krater of Heracles and Antaeus describes a famous fight in Greek mythology. It is one of the most beautiful pieces in the Louvre Museum and is signed by Euphronius, a painter whose refined style can be found on numerous objects around 510 B.C. when a pictorial change came to pass. The program describes the krater in detail, explains Athenian ceramic techniques and something of the life of Euphronius.
results.title_for_label: Euphronius painted: Krater of Heracles and Antaeus …

results.title: Eumig Wien Type P8 Electrical Projector in box
results.brief_description:
Boxed Projector Eumig Wien Type P8 electrical projector Housed in Vinyl bound box. Green felt covered board/lid for inside box. This board has a leather tab which helps to lift the board up. The top metal handle on the projector can be clicked in to stay up, or it can be pushed down. The feet at the front are adjustable and allow for a tilting adjustment. Lens: Coated Eupro F1.6 25mm lens The machine must be opened to erect the spool arms. Brown power cord with a Eumig logo. Australian power plug (Ring grip, 10 AMP, 250 V, Made in Australia) English instruction manual enclosed. Eumig metal spool housed in original cardboard box. Made in Austria.

Reel capacity: 120m / 400ft diameter: 175mm diameter x 13mm depth Kelvin clear plastic spool. Made in Australia.

Reel capacity: 120m / 400ft diameter: 177mm diameter x 14mm depth yellow piece of card ribbon inside.

2 identical Philips projection lamps in their original boxes with double sided instructions. The lamp inside the box is packaged between two pieces of corrugated cardboard. 7238N / 05 12V 100W B15S A8 Made in Germany

Broken brush made from real hair. Made in Japan. (used for cleaning?)
